kubejs.ponder.embers_aetherium_forge.tex: This is the Aetherium Forge
A Molten Fluid Source,
Ember,
Water,
and a Redstone Signal
Once all has been provided, the Forge will start to heat up
Just like most machines, this one can be extended too
Placing a Forge Dial shows the Heat of the Forge
As well as giving of a redstone signal based off of the Heat
As the Heat continues to rise, recipes will start to become available for you
To start of, place the Metal Former on top of the heated surface and provide it with an input
Heat and Ember are required for it to work
Don't forget to add Ember too
While progressing, Heat and Ember are being consumed
At high Heat, the Aetherium Forge starts to become dangerously unstable
This can be compensated with a Forge Heat Vent
Adding one more Vent evens out the Heat
For urgent cooling use a Forge Cooler
It's requirements are:
Any Cold Block,
Ember,
Water,
The Forge makes it possible to:
and a Redstone Signal
The cold block below will be used in the process
Note that placing a Fluid Vessel adjacent to the edges of the Forge fills the Metal Former with the same content
For the next part, a lot of heat is required
The Aetherium Anvil is used to break open Geodes but also purifies Tool Parts
The green exclamation mark indicates the item being ready to get struck by the Tinker's Hammer
Each hit drains Ember and increases Heat dependent on the recipe's Difficulty Rating
Hitting the anvil while a yellow mark is shown or not hitting it at all will count as a mistake
Three mistakes will destroy the item
In order to make use of the Tool Part, another apparatus is needed
Form Gems and Metals,
The Aetherium Tool Forge merges together multiple parts to create a new Tool
The heat has to be close to maximum in order to function
Place the Tool Parts in the designated input slot
When both Heat and Ember are present, strike it with the Hammer multiple times
Each hit consumes Ember and Heat
Lastly, pay attention to not go beyond the Heat Limit of 3000 or else...
Break Geodes,
Purify Tool Parts,
and Forge Tools
Heat is generated by the Forge Heater
The Forge Heater requires:
kubejs.ponder.embers_exchange_tablet.hea: Trial and Error using the Exchange Tablet
kubejs.ponder.embers_exchange_tablet.tex: The Exchange Tablet allows you to construct complicated items with the power of Alchemy
It involves taking risks like loosing ingredients
Parts of this construct include multiple Alchemy Pedestals
As well as a Beam Cannon
kubejs.ponder.embers_hearth_coil.header: Smelting Items with the Hearth Coil
kubejs.ponder.embers_hearth_coil.text_1: The Hearth Coil smelts items using Ember
kubejs.ponder.embers_hearth_coil.text_10: Heat Insulators increase the Max Heat of the Hearth Coil and reduces Cooling Speed when dormant
kubejs.ponder.embers_hearth_coil.text_11: Multiple Insulators can be attached until no more ports are left
kubejs.ponder.embers_hearth_coil.text_12: Lastly, optional Specialization Upgrades can be applied, doubling the speed for specific recipes
kubejs.ponder.embers_hearth_coil.text_13: Applying the Char Instiller doubles your speed for Smoking recipes only
kubejs.ponder.embers_hearth_coil.text_14: Atmospheric Bellows limits the Hearth Coil to only Blasting recipes, however at double the speed
kubejs.ponder.embers_hearth_coil.text_2: Mechanical Cores are used to extend inventories of blocks
kubejs.ponder.embers_hearth_coil.text_3: They are necessary to operate this type of contraption
kubejs.ponder.embers_hearth_coil.text_4: Up to 3 can be attached in a row
kubejs.ponder.embers_hearth_coil.text_5: Dials can be attached to view the amount of Ember, Heat and Items inside the Hearth Coil
kubejs.ponder.embers_hearth_coil.text_6: Comparators can be placed for better redstone control
kubejs.ponder.embers_hearth_coil.text_7: Ember Receptors are attachable as well
kubejs.ponder.embers_hearth_coil.text_8: Items have to be dropped on top of the heated coil to be smelted
kubejs.ponder.embers_hearth_coil.text_9: Once done, items can be pumped out using an Item Extractor and Item Pipes
kubejs.ponder.embers_moonlight_harvester: Gathering Aetherium with the Moonlight Harvester
The Moonlight Harvester is a construct made up of eight pillars
Each Moonlight Amplifier has to face the Refraction Prism
Now the structure should light up (Not replicable in ponder view)
At night the Moonlight Harvester will start collecting Impure Aetherium Sludge
Placing an Aetherium Focusing Matrix on the lower pillars, speeds up the collection process
kubejs.ponder.hephaestus.text_2: This is how you build it.
kubejs.ponder.hephaestus.text_3: Start by placing blocks of §9Arcane Chiseled Polished Darkstone§r at the highlighted spots
kubejs.ponder.hephaestus.text_4: Then, surround the center block with §9Chiseled Arcane Polished §9Darkstone
kubejs.ponder.hephaestus.text_5: To finish the first layer, surround all blocks with §9Polished Darkstone
kubejs.ponder.hephaestus.text_6: Finally, place a §9Smithing Table§r in the middle...
kubejs.ponder.obelisk.text_1: First, place an Arcane Polished Darkstone Block.
kubejs.ponder.obelisk.text_2: Then, place two Arcane Crystal Blocks above it.
kubejs.ponder.obelisk.text_3: Lastly, right-click to assemble the multiblock.
kubejs.ponder.obelisk.text_4: You can now mine it for the obelisk item!
